macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Market Steadies After Inflation Data Eases Concerns
items.summary: Major US stock indexes showed mixed performance on Friday, February 13, 2026, with the S&P 500 rising less than 0.1% and the Nasdaq falling 0.2%, as an encouraging inflation report helped calm market worries about AI disruption. Treasury yields fell following the softer-than-expected inflation data.

items.title: January CPI Comes in Softer Than Expected
items.summary: Consumer Price Index data for January 2026 showed inflation slowing, with CPI rising 0.2% month-over-month (2.4% year-over-year) and Core CPI rising 0.3% (2.5% year-over-year), both slightly below expectations.

items.title: Russell 2000 Outperforms With 1.2% Weekly Gain
items.summary: The Russell 2000 index of smaller companies rose 1.2% on Friday and is up 6.6% year-to-date, outperforming larger cap indexes amid the week's market volatility.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Market Signals Indicate Potential Crypto Recovery Amid Meme Coin Decline
items.summary: Binance's latest market update highlights top news for Bitcoin, Ethereum, and altcoins on February 14, 2026, with signals pointing to a potential recovery despite ongoing meme coin declines.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Machine Learning Breakthrough: FOCaL Framework Personalizes Treatment Effects from Complex Data
items.summary: Researchers introduced FOCaL, a doubly robust machine learning framework for analyzing functional outcomes over continuous domains like time or space, outperforming existing techniques in causal inference. Validated on real-world datasets including SHARE quality-of-life data and Italy's COVID-19 healthcare tracking, it advances personalized medicine and adaptive policy design.

items.title: AI Models Boost Food Allergy Diagnostics by 40% Over Standard Tests
items.summary: Machine learning and deep learning AI models demonstrated 40% improvement in diagnostic accuracy for food allergies compared to skin prick tests and oral challenges, with deep learning adding 10-15% further gains. Presented at the 2026 AAAAI Annual Meeting, highlighting strong predictive value of specific IgE markers.

items.title: FDA Authorizes Over 1,357 AI-Enhanced Medical Devices Amid Rising Surgical Complications
items.summary: The FDA has doubled its approvals of AI-enhanced medical devices to over 1,357 since 2022, but reports of complications and mistakes in AI-assisted surgeries are increasing. Spotlight on systems like TruDi raises concerns about integration risks.

items.title: New AI Method Fuses Expert Knowledge and Data to Accelerate Alloy Discovery
items.summary: Researchers advance AI for science by extracting and fusing cross-disciplinary expert knowledge with data, speeding up alloy discovery processes. This development promises broader applications in materials science.

items.title: Top AI Stocks to Watch: Upstart, Hut 8, Tempus AI, BigBear.ai, SoundHound AI
items.summary: MarketBeat highlights these five AI stocks with highest recent trading volume, including Upstart's AI lending platform and SoundHound's voice AI assistants. Reflects investor focus on AI-driven fintech, data centers, and applications amid market volatility.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance Next-Gen Update Released
items.summary: The next-gen update for Kingdom Come: Deliverance launched on February 13, topping the list of major gaming news for early February.

items.title: Ubisoft Cancels Six Games Amid Restructuring
items.summary: Ubisoft canceled six projects including Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time Remake, Project Ether, Project Pathfinder, Project Crest, Assassin's Creed Rebellion, and Assassin's Creed Singularity; Assassin's Creed: Black Flag Remake was spared.

items.title: Poker Night at the Inventory Remaster Announced for Switch, PS, PC
items.summary: A remaster of Telltale's classic Poker Night at the Inventory is coming to Switch, PlayStation, and PC, sparking hopes for a sequel.

items.title: New Turn-Based RPGs Released: Disciples: Domination, Vampire’s Fall 2
items.summary: Recent releases include Disciples: Domination (Feb 12, PC/PS/Xbox), Vampire’s Fall 2 (Feb 13, PC), plus Demiurges and Sector Unknown exiting Early Access.

items.title: Sony State of Play Breakdown Released
items.summary: A detailed video breakdown analyzes all games showcased at Sony's recent State of Play event.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Indian IT Stocks Plunge Amid AI Disruption Fears; Axis Securities Highlights Four Stocks for Gains
items.summary: The Nifty IT index dropped 4-6% on February 13, 2026, due to concerns over AI-led disruption, but Axis Securities recommends HCL Technologies, Tech Mahindra, Persistent Systems, and Coforge with significant upside potential despite valuation risks.

items.title: Global Technology Leaders Launch Trusted Tech Alliance at Munich Security Conference
items.summary: Fifteen companies from Africa, Asia, and Europe announced the Trusted Tech Alliance on February 13, 2026, at the Munich Security Conference to promote trusted technology practices.

items.title: Love's Travel Stops Opens First New Store of 2026 with EV Charger Space
items.summary: Love's opened its first new store of 2026, featuring RV parking, 50 car spots, and allocated space for EV chargers, as part of a broader plan to add 20 stores and 100 EV charges this year.

items.title: Indonesia Advances Micro-Scale Waste Processing Technologies for Village-Level Deployment
items.summary: President Prabowo Subianto announced plans to deploy university-developed micro-scale waste processing technologies to every village by 2026, alongside waste-to-energy projects, to address landfill accumulation.

items.title: Joanna Stern Departs The Wall Street Journal After 12 Years Covering Tech Transformations
items.summary: Prominent tech journalist Joanna Stern left WSJ on February 14, 2026, after 12 years, reflecting on how technology has reshaped various aspects of life.
